Buttons

Whenever using our button framework please ensure you either use an anchor or a button. Do not use an input. Button is to be used as the submit action on forms.

Primary

The primary button is used for any action where something is added to the page. E.g. Adding a new pattern.

Primary 
<a class="button primary">Primary</a>
<button class="button primary">Primary</button>

Secondary

The secondary button is used for any save actions on existing items. E.g. Editing an existing user.

Secondary 
<a class="button secondary">Secondary</a>
<button class="button secondary">Secondary</button>

Destructive

The destructive button is used for any actions where something is removed. The only situation where this isn't the case is in the action bar, in this situation use the trash icon. E.g. Delete confirmation modals.

Destructive 
<a class="button destructive">Destructive</a>
<button class="button destructive">Destructive</button>

Standard

The standard button is used for anytime the top three don't apply. For instance cancelling a form or managing patterns.

Standard 
<a class="button">Standard</a>
<button class="button">Standard</button>

Disabled

Anytime a button is in a state being unusable is should use the disabled state. A good example of this is a form that has nothing to save yet.

Standard 
<a class="button" disabled="disabled">Disabled</a>
<button class="button" disabled="disabled">Disabled</button>

Small

Small buttons are to be used when less prominence is required. A good example is inside tables.

Small 
<a class="button small">Small</a>
<button class="button small">Small</button>

Icon

Just change the name of the icon in the span and the icon framework will do the rest of the work for you. (The edit icon is typically used in tables in a small button which is part of a button group.)

<ul class="button_group">
        <li>
          <a class="button small"><span class="icon edit"></span></a>
        </li>
        <li>
          <a class="button small"><span class="icon delete"></span></a>
        </li>
      </ul>
      <a class="button">
        <span class="icon delete"></span>
      </a>

Dropdown

Using the dropdown button is currently used extensively across the application in the CRUD areas and default to being right positioned. To position them from the left add pos_left to the button_dropdown container.

  • Dropdown
    • Dropdown item #1
    • Dropdown item #2 
<ul class="button_group">
        <li class="dropdown">
          <a class="button primary" data-toggle="dropdown">
            <span class="icon right w_text white_caret"></span>
            Dropdown
          </a>
          <ul class="button_dropdown pos_left">
            <li>
              <a>Dropdown item #1</a>
            </li>
            <li>
              <a>Dropdown item #2</a>
            </li>
          </ul>
        </li>
      </ul>

Button group (joined)

Button groups allow you to join multiple buttons together. Multiple groups can be placed within a button bar, the important thing to remember is adding 'left' for the float otherwise they will tile vertically. If you just have one group leave the float off.

  • Button
  • Button
  • Button
  • Button
  • Button
<div class="button_bar">
        <ul class="button_group left">
          <li><a class="button">Button</a></li>
          <li><a class="button">Button</a></li>
          <li><a class="button">Button</a></li>
        </ul>
        <ul class="button_group left">
          <li><a class="button">Button</a></li>
          <li><a class="button">Button</a></li>
        </ul>
      </div>

Button group (not joined)

  • Button
  • Button
  • Button
<div class="button_bar">
        <ul class="button_group left">
          <li><a class="button">Button</a></li>
        </ul>
        <ul class="button_group left">
          <li><a class="button">Button</a></li>
        </ul>
        <ul class="button_group left">
          <li><a class="button">Button</a></li>
        </ul>
      </div>
